bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 58 (Wednesday, April 3, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. AXNE:H.R. 2059.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 18 of the United StatesConstitution.[Page H3069]

item.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend certain expiring provisions, to provide disaster tax relief, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 28.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

summary.text: This bill permanently extends the second generation biofuel producer tax credit. (Under current law, the tax credit expired at the end of 2017.)

bill.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to make permanent the second generation biofuel producer credit.

item.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to make permanent the second generation biofuel producer credit.
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to make permanent the second generation biofuel producer credit.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
